intro: Arctotis kraussii, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disc of smaller florets. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, often with a slight woolly texture. Arctotis kraussii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
